title: American_Top_40_1984_September_22nd
description:
A storm rolled through and lightning took out both my computers, my only modem, and all my software. All this only twelve hours before I began recording the 20 shows I record every week. But that didn't stop the countdown that doesn't stop till we reach the top.

"I'm Casey Kasem, this is American Top 40, and our countdown begins in a moment."


What does Elton John have in common with Kenny Rogers, Deborah Harry, and Brooke Shields? Casey tells us all.

Casey answers the question, "What foreign artists from non-English speaking countries have been the most successful on the American charts?" Casey Gives the top five.

We find out whatever happened to The Village People.

Ten songs have made the top 40 twice (such as "Rock Around The Clock" by Bill Hailey and The Comets), but only one has ever hit number one twice. Casey tells the story.

Casey tells how the first marriage performed by Little Richard went.

A listener wants to know if anyone of Oriental descent has ever made the chart. Casey fills him in.

LW#3: She Bop - Cyndi Lauper
